title: **How much oral solution should the patient take to achieve the same therapeutic effect? Give your answer to the nearest whole number.**
text:
An 18-year-old male has been prescribed emtricitabine 200 mg once daily in capsule form for HIV-1 infection. The patient has difficulty swallowing the capsules and requests to switch to the oral solution form. Emtricitabine is available as a 10mg/mL oral solution. 

An extract has been provided for this question:
why:
**Step 1: Calculate equivalent dose** 
200 x 93% / 75% = 248mg 

**Step 2: Calculate the volume of oral solution by dividing the dose of oral solution (248 mg) by the concentration of oral solution (10 mg/mL):**

 248 mg / 10 mg/mL = 24.8 mL`

**Step 3: Round the volume of oral solution to the nearest whole number:**
24.8 mL ~ 25 mL`

title: **Calculate the duration of the infusion, in minutes. Give your answer as a whole number**.
text: A 15 year old female patient has been prescribed 500mL of a glucose 5% infusion for the treatment of hypoglycemia. The drop rate of the infusion is set to 35 drops/min.
why:
**Step 1: Know the general rule… 20 drops in 1mL**
500ml x 20 drops = 10,000 drops 

**Step 2: Calculate duration of infusion** 
10,000 drops/35 drops = 285.71428 mins → 286 mins

Note: you need to learn that 20 drops = 1ml

title: **Using the resource pack provided, calculate how many inhalers are needed to provide her with a 56 day supply of treatment.**
text:
A 20-year-old female with asthma has been prescribed Flutiform 125/5mcg inhaler with aerochamber plus Flow-Vu spacer device 
Her dose is “Two inhalations each morning and evening” 

An extract has been provided for this question
why:
**Step 1: calculate the total number of puffs for a 56 day treatment** 
Two puffs twice a day → this is a total of 4 puffs each day ( 2 x 2 = 4). 
4 puffs each day x 56 days = 224 puffs. 

**Step 2: In the resource pack find out the number of doses in each inhaler** 
Flutiform 125micrograms/dose / 5micrograms/dose inhaler Napp Pharmaceuticals Ltd
Active ingredients
Fluticasone propionate 125 microgram per 1 dose, Formoterol fumarate dihydrate 5 microgram per 1 dose
Size: 120
Unit: dose
NHS indicative price
£28.00


Each inhaler has 120 doses, 
**Step 3: divide total amount of puffs by the puffs available in inhaler** 
The patient will need a total of 224 puffs. Each inhaler has 120 puffs. 
224/120 = 1.86666 
You cannot get 0.8666 of an inhaler so you would need to round up to 2.
